QREC.CO_ParaFL: المذيع: في ضوء دراسةٍ أعدها معهد العلاقات الدولية الألماني على عينة من الأوروبيين تمثل مختلف الشرائح الاجتماعية, طٌرح محور هذه الدراسة وهو تساؤل مفاده ماذا يخطر ببالك عندما تسمع كلمة إسلام؟ الإجابات كانت أن الصورة التي يحملها أغلب الأوروبيين عن المجتمعات الإسلامية سلبية إلى حدٍ كبير. نحو ثلاثة أرباع المشاركين في الدراسة ردّوا بأن الإسلام يعني بالنسبة لهم قمع المرأة والتطرف والإرهاب. ولم يقدم إلا نحو ربع المشاركين إجابات تعكس رؤيةً أفضل للديانة الإسلامية. كما أوضح باحثون أوروبيون وعرب شاركوا في ندوة نُظِمت على هامش معرض فرانكفورت الدولي للكتاب لبحث هذا الموضوع, أوضحوا أن ثمة نظرة سطحية شائعة عن الإسلام في أوروبا وفي الغرب عامة لا تشتمل على الجوانب الحضارية والإنسانية الكثيرة التي يزخر بها الإسلام
QREC.CO_ParaXL: Anchor: A study prepared by the German International Relations Institute sampled the opinions of Europeans representing various social sectors, based on the question "What comes to your mind when you hear the word Islam?" The answers showed that the image most Europeans have of Islamic societies is, to a large extent, negative. Approximately three-quarters of respondents in the study replied that to them, Islam means the oppression of women, extremism, and terrorism. Only one-quarter of respondents had answers that reflected a better vision of the Islamic religion. European and Arab researchers who participated in a forum organized to discuss this issue in conjunction with the International Frankfurt Book Exhibition also explained that there is a common superficial view in Europe and in the West in general that does not include the many civilized and humanitarian aspects of Islam.

الضيف: أهلا وسهلاً بك.

QREC.CO_ParaXL:
Anchor: We will now turn to listener Rafi’ Sa’eed who is calling from Ramadi in Iraq. Welcome, Mr. Rafi’.

Guest: Welcome.

Anchor: Rafi’, what is your opinion of the study's conclusion about the prevailing negative view, which appears occasionally or often in the Western media? What do you think, and what can Islam and Islamic society do to change this view?

Guest: Yes, thank you. First, I congratulate you on the occasion of the Holy Month of Ramadan and I say season’s greetings.

Anchor: And to you as well. Go ahead.

Guest: Second of all, there is no doubt that Islam is God Almighty’s religion with which he completed all religions and messages. The problem now is not to convince others of Islam, the problem is the image the anti-Islamic media is trying to form about Islam.

QREC.RIGHT_FB:
Good match!

  • The two matching terms you heard are:  شائعة and رائجة . Both terms are adjectives and mean (common/ popular).
  • Note that the term  شائعة can also be used as a noun and means a rumor, as in شائعة نهاية العالم  (rumor about the end of the world).

Grammar note

  • The adjectives رائجة  and  شائعة  are both derived respectively from the two hollow verbs  راج  and شاع , meaning (to spread) as in  شاع خبر سقوط حائط برلين  (the fall of the Berlin wall became well known).
  • The  noun  شائعة  means a rumor : i.e., a piece of unreliable news that spreads fast
  • The verb  راج  also means (to circulate) and it is related to the noun  رواج .
  • So when one says  راجت الأخبار  or  شاعت الأخبار ,  it means the same as the news spread
QREC.WRONG_FB:
Incorrect choice!

The matching words relate to an unverified account or explanation of events circulating from person to person. Focus on the roots : ر ا ج
QREC.RIGHT_FB:
Good match!

The two matching terms you heard are  قمع and قهر . They are both verbal nouns and  mean (suppression/ oppression).

Grammar note

  • The  verbal noun قمع  is derived from the measure I verb قَمَعَ  (to oppress) and can be used in phrases such as  قمع المرأة  (female oppression) or as in  قمع المُتظاهرين(suppression of demonstrators).
  • The verbal noun  قهر  is derived from the measure I verb قهر
QREC.WRONG_FB:

Note that the matching words are verbal nouns. They refer to the exercise of authority or power in  cruel, and/or unjust manner.
QREC.RIGHT_FB:

The two matching phrases you heard are:الطبقات الاجتماعية and الشرائح الاجتماعية. They are both  noun phrases and  mean (social classes/ strata of society).

Grammar note

  • The noun طبقة   can mean a class of people or also layers, as in  طبقة الأوزون  (ozone layer).
  • The noun شرائح  is the plural form of thr singular noun  شريحة , which can mean either a slice as in شريحة لحم (slice of meat), or segment as in شريحة المجتمع  (segment/ class of society).
QREC.WRONG_FB:

Note that the matching terms are noun phrases, and they relate to a certain section of society. Focus on the root ج م ع  and  ش ر ح
QREC.RIGHT_FB:

The two matching terms you heard are الأديا and الرسالات . They are plural nouns meaning respectively religions and God messages.

Grammar note

  • The noun الرسالات is the plural form of the noun رسالة (letter/ message). Noticed that this latter singular noun can also have رسائل as a plural, but in this case it means letters.
  • Sometimes in Arabic, religions are referred to as الرسالات (messages). It is understood that all religions entail a message رسالة .

QREC.RIGHT_FB:

The two matching terms you heard are  تَشدد and تطرف . They are both verbal nouns meaning extremism/ radicalism.

Grammar note

  • تَطرُّف  is the verbal noun derived from the measure V verb تطرَّف  (to be an extremist). It literally means to be/ go on the far side. This verbal noun is usually used in a religious context as تطرف ديني (religious extremism).
  • Both nouns   تطرف  and   تشدد (extremism) are used to describe a radicalism either in religion contexts or personality.

QREC.ACTY_DESCRIPTION: Predict the content of the audio by listening to the announcer's introduction,
QREC.POP_UP: The program’s guest believes that God sent messengers to every nation. He believes that God sent Muhammad to transmit the message of the Qur'an, the holy book which, according to Islam, is universal in its message. The reason that Muslims believe the Qur'an is universal and will remain uncorrupted is because they feel that previous holy books, in particular the Torah given to Moses; the Psalms given to David; and the Gospel given to Jesus, were for a specific time and community. They feel that, even if the books were corrupted, many prophets were still to come to tell the people what was corrupt in the scripture. Muhammad therefore, being the last prophet, was given a book that, according to Islam, will remain in its true form till the Last Day. In this lesson, you will notice that parts of the guest's views and opinions are taken from the ideas mentioned above.

QREC.FB:

Correct choice!

Yes. The anchor talks about a survey carried out in Europe to evaluate Europeans’ view on Islam:

"...دراسةٍ أعدها معهد العلاقات الدولية الألماني على عينة من الأوروبيين تمثل مختلف الشرائح الاجتماعية, طٌرح محور هذه الدراسة وهو تساؤل مفاده ماذا يخطر ببالك عندما تسمع كلمة إسلام؟..."

"...A study prepared by the German International Relations Institute sampled the opinions of Europeans representing various social sectors, based on the question 'What comes to your mind when you hear the word Islam?""

  • The noun  عينة (sample) is often used in science and medicine and means (biopsy).
  • The phrasal verb خطر ببالك  (comes to your mind) is composed of the verb يخطر (occur) and of the prepositional phrase ببالك (to/ with your mind). Note that this verbal phrase is most often associated with the noun  سؤال  (question) as in : آه ..سؤال خطر ببالي... (Oh...a question came to my mind...!).
  • The author uses the verbal phrase خطر ببالك  in a question and preceded with the interrogation marker ماذا؟ (what?).

According to the anchor, how do the researchers who participated in the forum discussion evaluate/perceive the prevailing views of Islam in Europe?
QREC.FB:
حسب الاستطلاع معظم الأوروبيين يرون الإسلام بشكل سلبي

According to the survey, most Europeans look at the religion of Islam negatively:

"... كانت أن الصورة التي يحملها أغلب الأوروبيين عن المجتمعات الإسلامية سلبية إلى حدٍ كبير...نحو ثلاثة أرباع المشاركين في الدراسة ردّوا بأن الإسلام يعني بالنسبة لهم قمع المرأة والتطرف والإرهاب ..."

"...The answers showed that the image most Europeans have of Islamic societies is, to a large extent, negative...approximately three-quarters of respondents in the study replied that to them, Islam means the oppression of women, extremism, and terrorism..."

  • The adjective   سلبية  (negative) modifies the noun الصورة (the image). This adjective collocates usually with nouns such as موقف  or  رأي  as in  موقف سلبي  (negative attitude) or as in رأي سلبي  (negative opinion).
  • The adverbial إلى حد كبير  (to a large extent) can also be rephrased كثيراً  (very much/a lot). However, when one uses the phrase الى حد كبير , the denotation is too much/ more that expected).
  • The noun الارهاب (terrorism) is a verbal noun derived from the measure IV verb  أرهب (to scare/ terrorize).
  • Note that إرهابي (terrorist) is a newly-coined term. Normally, it is derived from the verb أرهب  (to terrorize) is مُرهب  (the thing or person who scares). So the term إرهابي  (terrorist) conveys within it a negative sense of that who commits a political or religious terrorist act.
  • Another newly coined term is إسلامي (islamist). This latter denotes a Muslim person who uses the religion of Islam for political targets. However, the term مُسلم  (Muslim) denotes a person who practices his Muslim faith peacefully.

Cultural Tip:

The phrase سبحان الله or  سبحانه  is an eloquent Arabic phrase used mainly in praying. Its translated meaning is تنزيه الله عز وجل عن كل سوء (Allah all Almighty is infallible and transcends any bad or evil doing). The term سبحان  is actually derived from the measure II verb سبَّح  ( eternal glorifying and praising od Allah).
